item.title: [Can be removed]
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

[quote=“Protosstribe, post:1, topic:107246”]Yes. I will start to think about some ideas.

And just a question: What requirements should we have to be able to join the team? Or should it be open for anyone to contribute? Just if we got it open for anyone, you never know when someone that is not very good in Java tries to write things to the code (if in an SVN for example), and just accidentally do something wrong… That wouldn’t be very fun.[/quote]

But if everyone has a copy of the updated version with no errors, why would it matter if someone messed up. You could just give them the updated download link again so they can retry. Also I wouldn’t mind helping out with this. Private servers and client hacking is getting a bit boring. I’d like to try something new.

Read full topic

item.title: [Can be removed]
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Yes of course, JOGL takes a LOT… which is why LWJGL was made… Light-Weight Java Graphics Library ! YAY… or as java got its calling card win-all-or-kill-all position in server structure, why not a java server (as it’s stable-tastic) and a c/c++ or delphi, or ruby, or some other extensible language for the client… I’m alright in c/c++, im sure with the amount of games using DirectX and OpenGL, documentation wouldn’t be too terribly bad…

Or we could use some engine such as Source and make a first person shooter, actually sounds fun… Medievil has been done(Dark Messiah), magical has be done(Dark Messiah), futuristic done(Natural Selection), and present done(Counter Strike); your award winning Sci-Fi (Half Life); What about something that hasn’t been done. Something like based of a british classic; where millions of years in the future, there’s a bunch of “evolutions” of humans with different traits, and advanced technologies, versus something…

Like humans that are pre-cognative, and humans that are extrememly quick (agility) and humans that are strong… of course each one has evolved this way, the quick eat alot and are very light, relatively tall… pre cognative eat alot too, but are relatively slow and light, the strong evolved backward bending knees as it gives more leverage; longer bones, more muscles for strength, different facial features… Other’s that are generic humans as we would see them today, but with slightly increased… everything; like being able to see further? Swimmers… thinkers ? etc Psychic humans, and have like multiple sects of humans versus each other and versus different species like i dunno, aliens is way too over-done… As is gothic themes, but what about religious themes? Most religions have some form of thoughtless, moral-less angelic warriors and demonic-evil-doer’s… Like say hell the plot of the story is, heaven and hell are full, so both are displaced? into reality and human kind is trying (failing) to survive?

Yay I’m bored and my idea’s suck, what’s yours?

Read full topic

item.title: [Can be removed]
item.dc:creator: @KryptoN KryptoN_
item.description:
@KryptoN wrote:

I agree with this point:

Start out simple, maybe a 2D game at first, then, when you get the storyline down, and you have the player base you need to be successful, you begin on 3D, just like what RuneScape did.

Don’t start out big, work on something small first; improve on ideas, and team cooperation.

Read full topic

item.title: [Can be removed]
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I’m going to put in a few suggestions, just because I’d like to see this project idea get somewhere. Because of what happened last time I gave suggestions to people about a community project, I’m going to state again these are merely suggestions, nothing more.

[ul][li]If you’re going to make a game, there should be a team, the team should be endorsed by the community, advertising, Titles, Symbols next to their name possibly?[/li]
[li]There should be a category on the Moparisthebest forum, within the category, there will be a public area, for the community, and a private area for the Staff of MITB, and the Project Group to discuss.[/li]
[li]The game shouldn’t be set in present day, mainly because it will restrict what you can and can’t do, unless it’s like a parallel universe (similar to Full Metal Alchemist). If it were to be in present day, you’d have trouble with, political correctness, History, etc. People would criticize every detail of the game if it were present day.[/li]
[li]I would suggest you do it in the past, because it’s what everyone knows, most likely Middle Ages, but with that Time period, You’d have to be very original to capture an audience.[/li]
[li]Start out simple, maybe a 2D game at first, then, when you get the storyline down, and you have the player base you need to be successful, you begin on 3D, just like what RuneScape did.[/li]
[li]It would be a very good idea to make a new community for the game once it becomes popular enough, not to steal thunder from MITB, but, it would be time to become a real game, with its own website, community. MITB, and Moparscape would still be affiliated in some way, but it would be best for the game to become more corporate.[/li][/ul]

These suggestions may have been stated before, but I’m just saying them off of the top of my head, if I have anything that should be added, I’ll either edit it in, or post some more.

Read full topic
